title: Daniel Kirkpatrick
text:
Daniel Kirkpatrick (born 28 November 1988) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He currently plays for the in <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a>. He has also played for <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a> in the <a href="Mitre%2010%20Cup">Mitre 10 Cup</a>.
Prior to his 2012 move to France, he played for the <a href="Wellington%20Hurricanes">Hurricanes</a> in <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> and for <a href="Hawke%27s%20Bay%20Rugby%20Union">Hawkes Bay</a> in the <a href="ITM%20Cup">ITM Cup</a>. He made his Hurricanes debut in 2009. In 2010 he played for the <a href="Blues%20%28Super%20Rugby%29">Auckland Blues</a>, before returning to Wellington in 2011.
He was a part of the team that won the 2007 IRB U19 World Championship in Belfast, and the New Zealand U20 team that contested the IRB U20 World Cup in Wales.
In 2012 it was announced that he had signed with French club Castres.
He signed with SC Albi in 2016.
Honours.
Club.
 <a href="Castres%20Olympique">Castres</a>
